intro: Pogonospermum australe, commonly known as the Australian beardgrass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Pogonospermum australe is adapted to survive in harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient component of native vegetation.
